image.altText: a person holding a rainbow flag

props.synopsis: Questions on both sexual orientation and gender will feature in Australia's next census, as the federal government seeks to repair the fallout from earlier efforts to abandon questions about LGBTIQ+ identity.

title.children: 'LGBTIQ+ Australians matter': Sexual orientation and gender questions to feature in next census

image.altText: A teen checks her Twitter notifications.

props.synopsis: Social media giants would be forced to ban children under the age of 14 from their platforms or face hefty penalties, under proposed laws in South Australia that could be replicated in other states.

title.children: 'Big, massive deterrent': Social media companies could face fines for allowing kids under 14 on their platforms

image.altText: Actress Nicole Kidman with her mother Janelle Ann Kidman as they attend the 2018 AACTA Awards

props.synopsis: The Australian actress leaves the film festival after learning the news her mother had died aged 84.Â

title.children: Nicole Kidman reveals mother's death in Venice Film Festival acceptance speech

image.altText: Madison de Rozario competing at the 2024 Paris Paralympics.

image.altText: A group of rugby league players celebrate a try

props.synopsis: Manly fall short of claiming a home final after going down to Cronulla while the Knights lead the Dolphins as they look to squeeze into the top eight. Follow live.

title.children: Ponga brilliance helps Knights lead Dolphins in fight for last NRL finals spot

image.altText: A man, Brett Button, standing in a crowd of people with news cameras surrounding him

props.synopsis:
Ten people died when the bus Brett Andrew Button was driving crashed on the way home from a wedding. This week he is expected to receive a jail term, but not before hearing from dozens of the victims' family and friends and those who survived the crash.

Â 

Â

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash driver to come face to face with devastated loved ones of those killed

image.altText: Heavy white smoke billows from the southern Lebanese Marjayoun terrain following heavy Israeli shelling

props.synopsis: An Israeli air strike has killed three Lebanese paramedics, according to the Lebanese health ministry, marking the second such attack on an emergency team in less than 12 hours.

title.children: Israeli strike kills three medics in southern Lebanon, health ministry says

image.altText: A young boy in a spiderman outfit with a grey picture in the background of people searching a bush.

props.synopsis: A decade after the boy in the Spider-Man suit vanished from his foster grandmother's home on the NSW Mid North Coast, police are no closer to finding him.Â

title.children: Why we may never know what happened to William Tyrrell

image.altText: King Charles and Queen Camilla pose formally in dress wear in an ornate room with gold furnishing.

props.synopsis: King Charles has been dragged into a Senate drama over an obscure push to remove references to Queen Elizabeth from Australia's laws.Â

title.children: A royal clean-up sparks Senate fight over King Charles

image.altText: A bright electronic billboard advertising the turquoise waters of Fiji in a neon lit streetscape in China.

title.children: 'The bad guy is the first to complain': Is China 'weaponising' tourism in the Pacific?

image.altText: Composite of Rupert Murdoch, his two daughters and two sons

props.synopsis: Lachlan Murdoch turns 53 today, his first birthday since taking over the family's media empire from his father Rupert in November. And if he finds himself in a contemplative state of mind, how might he reflect upon the great balance sheet of life?

title.children: The bitter battle tearing a family apart: Inside the Murdochs' real-life Succession drama

image.altText: A graphic shows a woman with a blurred face looking at a mobile phone with a message above her.

props.synopsis: After a university student was bombarded with doctored, sexually explicit images of herself, the abusive comments started. So did a plan to bring down the perpetrators of what one expert describes as a problem so rife in South Korea it is "national disaster".

title.children: It started with a flood of 'ominous' texts. Then Ruma saw her face on fake porn images

image.altText: Man wearing white shirt surrounded by people pointing mobile phones at him

props.synopsis: Prosecutors issued an arrest warrant for Edmundo Gonzalez in connection with the online publication of election result tallies.

title.children: Venezuela opposition candidate leaves country for asylum in Spain as diplomatic tensions rise

props.synopsis: As Australia's electricity system gets cleaner, it is encountering a strange problem. More renewable energy is having to be wasted.Â

title.children: Rob super, end tax breaks: Australia's verdict on fixing housing policy

image.altText: A close up of the Queen smiling in a purple coat and matching hat.

props.synopsis: Two years ago an important chapter in royal history came to a full stop with the death of Queen Elizabeth II. Everything was about to change.

title.children: The Queen was dead; long live King Charles. Then everything changed

image.altText: Cars driving along a road in the city.

props.synopsis: Point-to-point speed cameras, which calculate a driver's average speed between two points, will be switched on for all vehicles travelling on the Pacific Highway between Kew and Lake Innes and the Hume Highway between Coolac and Gundagai.

title.children: Average speed cameras to be trialled for cars in regional NSW

image.altText: More than a dozen young French men and women shout as they climb on top of a statue.

props.synopsis: A majority of French people now consider President Emmanuel Macron to have "stolen" the country's recent legislative election, after he chose centre-right former Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier to form a government despite a leftist coalition winning the most seats.Â

title.children: Thousands protest in France after Macron refuses to name leftist prime minister

image.altText: Parked vehicles block the lanes on a highway in the late evening.

props.synopsis: The local sheriff's office has named a 32-year-old man as a person if interest in connection with the shootings, saying he should be considered armed and dangerous.

title.children: Kentucky police hunting suspect after drivers shot in traffic on interstate highway

image.altText: A close up image of a man wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Two new reports paint a picture of an overburdened and under-resourced mental health system, with about 75 per cent of Australians feeling elevated levels of distress compared to the same time last year.

title.children: Linda felt let down after her husband died by suicide.  Two decades later, people are still falling through the cracks

props.synopsis: These First Nations students are the traditional people of the New South Wales Snowy Mountains, yet some of them had never set foot on snow before.

image.altText: Fresh tiger prawns piled on top of each other.

props.synopsis: Amid low export prices and high economic costs, the northern prawn industry wants to see more tiger prawns on Australian plates.

title.children: Aussies urged to splurge on local wild-caught tiger prawns, as export market wanes

image.altText: A woman stands on an empty block of land in a housing development.

props.synopsis: Ipswich was once the affordable alternative to Brisbane, but with house prices soaring by more than 80 per cent it has left many asking where else they can go to get on the property ladder.

title.children: It was once a haven for people priced out of Brisbane. Now house prices have almost doubled

image.altText: The Regent Theatre on Collins Street in Melbourne.

title.children: Half of iconic Melbourne theatre to be sold off in mayoral re-election bid

image.altText: Side view close-up of pregnant woman touching her belly

props.synopsis: Obstetricians at Australia's first forum on private obstetrics say the closure of private maternity services is putting pressure on the public system and forcing some women to travel to give birth.Â

title.children: Obstetricians want birthing data made public

image.altText: A lady with white shirt sits on stairs and smiles

props.synopsis: After a shock cancer diagnosis, Ros Worthington is spending her final weeks preparing her close family and friends for her end-of-life while pushing for access to voluntary assisted dying to be extended to people with dementia.Â

title.children: With no option left but to die, Ros is spending her last weeks with family â and pushing to expand voluntary assisted dying
